revised_title: Discovery of Allylic Alcohol and Its Derivatives
tldr: The authors, Augustus William Hofmann and Augustus Cahours, discovered a new class of alcohols called allylic alcohol and its derivatives. They found that allylic alcohol has a pungent odor, is combustible, and is similar in composition to acetone and propylic aldehyde. The authors also studied the reactions and properties of allylic alcohol, including its transformation into acrolein and allylic acid, and its reaction with various oxidizing agents.
